articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel bombed an area near the presidential palace in Damascus early on Friday, in its clearest warning yet to Syria's new Islamist-led authorities of its readiness to ramp up military action in the name of the country's Druze minority.
articles.title: Israel strikes near Syria's presidential palace in 'message' to new leader Sharaa

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said his administration will strip Harvard University of its tax exempt status.
articles.title: Trump to take away Harvard’s tax exempt status

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Friederike Heine
articles.description: Germany's spy agency on Friday classified the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) as "extremist", enabling it to step up monitoring of the country's biggest opposition party, which decried the move as a "blow against democracy".
articles.title: German spy agency brands far-right AfD as 'extremist', opens way for closer surveillance
Farage's Reform UK Party wins mayoral and parliamentary post in surge of support

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Donald Trump on Friday asked Congress to approve $3.2 billion in contributions to the World Bank's International Development Association (IDA), which provides low- or zero-interest loans to the world's poorest countries.
articles.title: Trump's budget includes $3.2 bln for World Bank's fund for poorest countries

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prince Harry on Friday lost his legal challenge to changes to his security arrangements made by the British government following his decision to step down from royal duties with his American wife Meghan.
articles.title: Prince Harry loses legal fight with UK government over police protection

articles.author: Christopher Scicluna, Ilze Filks
articles.description: A ship bound for Gaza carrying humanitarian aid and activists was bombed by drones in international waters off Malta early on Friday, its organisers said, alleging that Israel was to blame.
articles.title: Activist aid ship hit by drones on way to Gaza, NGO says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A magnitude 7.4 earthquake struck Drake Passage between Cape Horn and Antarctica at a depth of just 10 km (6 miles) on Friday, the United States Geological Survey said.
articles.title: Chile evacuates remote southern coast region as 7.4 quake sparks tsunami risk

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said on Friday he would be in Washington next Tuesday for what he expects will be "difficult but constructive" talks with U.S. President Donald Trump, who he has accused of trying to break Canada.
articles.title: Carney expects 'difficult but constructive' talks with Trump next week

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Peruvian navy vessel collided with an oil platform operated by Perenco on the Amazon River leaving two people dead and one missing Peru's defense ministry said on Friday.
articles.title: At least two dead after Peru navy vessel hits Perenco oil platform in Amazon
